heading: at home in japan
subheading: the cable internet company continues its overseas expansion, joining with japanese corporations to provide high-speed access to the island nation.
author: wired news report
text: at home said on wednesday that it is joining up with jupiter telecommunications -- japan's largest cable operator -- and sumitomo corp. to offer high-speed cable internet service in japan. the venture, to be called @home japan, will have access to about 5 million homes, a little over 10 percent of japanese households.the agreement gives at home a foothold in one of the world's largest cable markets, where the number of internet users is rising rapidly. japan has about 15 million internet users, said at home vice president john o'farrell, making it a prime market for broadband service.the company said it is also in talks with other cable operators to try and get them to join @home japan as shareholders or distributors.at home now has about 330,000 customers for its high-speed cable service in the united states and canada, and says has the potential to reach 60 million homes. earlier, at home struck a deal in the netherlands to launch at home nederland.
